article.headline: Palantir files for resale of up to 244.2 million shares, which could be valued at roughly $1.5 billion
article.body: Palantir Technologies Inc. PLTR, -0.50% filed Wednesday for the resale of up to 244.23 million shares of its Class A stock by selling shareholders.The data software company said in Tuesday's filing that "based on information available," the Class A stock has traded in private transactions between $4.17 and $11.50 from Jan. 1, 2020 through Sept. 1, 2020, with a volume-weighted average price (VWAP) of $6.02. Based on the VWAP, the shares for resale would be valued at $1.47 billion. Palantir filed last month to go public through a direct listing, which does not involve the sale of new shares to the public like with a traditional initial public offering. The company expects its stock to start trading on the NYSE on or about Sept. 23, under the ticker symbol "PLTR." The company is looking to go public at a time that the Renaissance IPO ETF IPO, +1.98% has rallied 20.1% over the past three months while the S&P 500 SPX, +0.87% has gained 3.9%.
